author: Nathan Dougherty

Allen Gives Back
Allen announced this week that he is working with USAA and The Veterans of Foreign Wars to give two Super Bowl tickets to Iraq War veteran Cory Geisler, a Staff Sergeant in the U.S. Army who served from 2005 to 2012.

As the Buffalo News noted, the donations — made mostly in increments of $17 to honor Allen’s jersey and $13 to commemorate the time remaining after Allen threw the go-ahead touchdown — totaled more than $400,000.

Allen a Magnet for Philanthropy
Aside from his own charitable acts around Buffalo, Allen has inspired many others to give, especially Bills fans.
After the Bills suffered a heartbreaking loss to the Kansas City Chiefs on January 23, many Chiefs fans took to donating to the Oishei Children’s Hospital to honor Allen’s performance.
When his grandmother died during the 2020 season, fans came together to honor her memory by making donations to Allen’s favorite cause in Buffalo, the Oishei Children’s Hospital.
My family and I cannot even begin to express our gratitude for the support this community has shown us,” Allen said this year when he got to see the end result of the donations.
